page.title: 04THE CHURCH
page.content: {St. Edmunds}is the name of the Church in Crickhowell. It was first built in{1303}and it is the oldest used building in the area. On a Sunday 18 people pray at 8.30 a.m. and 45 people at 10.00 a.m. About 12 people pray at 6 p.m. Altogether in Crickhowell about 100 people out of 1600 people ,about 6 per cent, attend one or other of the various churches. A hundred years ago the churches would have been full. Most of the alterations were made under the Victorians. The church has a{clock}in the tower which has two faces and not four. This is because the man who paid for it had a{quarrel}with the townspeople and would not allow a face of the clock to be put so that it could be seen from the town.
